intro: Seseli montanum subsp. granatense, commonly known as the Granatense Seseli, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a subtle, herbaceous scent. This subspecies is typically found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine habitats.
